Site Manager – Disability Employment Services (DES)

Company Name Box Hill Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time fixed term positions to July 2020 (with probable 3 year extension)
  • Lilydale location
  • $80,746 to $88,937 (PACCT 7) per annum plus compulsory superannuation

BHI is now delivering the DES program on behalf of the Commonwealth Department of Social Services.

About The Role

The Site Manager – DES ensures the successful development and delivery of high quality Disability Employment Services (DES) at the Lilydale site including the Maroondah Employment Services Area (ESA) outreach sites. The position focuses on the provision of professional and client centric employment services through leadership, operational management and building strong collaborative relationships with industry, disability service providers, stakeholders and local communities within the designated region.

This position as part of the Jobs Engagement Team is responsible for the delivery of DES to clients at Ringwood and associated outreach locations within the Maroondah DES ESA. This position manages the successful delivery of DES in the Maroondah Region to meet key performance indicators (KPIs), comply with contractual obligations and program guidelines, in accordance with relevant statutory, regulatory and BHI Group requirements.

The positon is a part of BHI Employment Services and sits within the Jobs and Engagement Team to enhance the capacity and capability of the BHI Group to bridge the gap between the current and future needs of key growth sectors and the skills of potential employees.

Your Skills And Experience

 A relevant qualification or training in Business Management or Disability Support or Employment Services is desirable.
Program Delivery: Substantial experience working in Disability Employment Services. Demonstrated experience in an operational management role within a related sector
People Management
Delivery of Results: Proven outcomes in delivering results in line with program timelines and budget, and KPIs.
Stakeholder Management: Identifies and manages a range of complex and competing needs, identifies mutually beneficial partnerships and finds innovative solutions to resolve stakeholder issues.
  • Resource Management: Demonstrated experience in managing and monitoring budgets, financial reporting, compliance management and administration, managing and negotiating physical, human and financial resources.

    You will need to provide or be willing to obtain a current National Police Records Check, a Working with Children Check, evidence of your entitlement to work in Australia, and certified copies of your qualifications.

    Benefits

    Interested in starting a career with one of Australia's leading Institutes? At BHI Group we value our people. We offer more than just a job; we offer benefits to enhance your work life, help you grow, and celebrate your achievements.

    Like to know more? If you have questions about this role, please contact Jane Young at j.young@boxhill.edu.au or by phone on 9286 9782.

    Applications close: 9am, Wednesday 5 September 2018.

    Box Hill Institute is a child safe and equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in our workforce and encourage people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply for our vacancies.

    The Box Hill Institute Group reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

Support Manager

Company Name Annexa - NetSuite Solution Provider Company Location Port Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 334 views

Job description

Annexa is an award-winning Oracle NetSuite Consulting Practise. Our Vision is to transform the work of business by turning complex problems into opportunities for innovation. Co Creating the next generation of business systems through innovative thinking, collaborative partnerships, and long-term customer satisfaction.


Our professional services include Project Management, Business Analysis, Implementation, Optimization, Training, Development and Support.\xa0


Annexa is currently implementing a very strong customer focused support model and is seeking highly motived individual to guide and manage customer support representatives.


The Support Managers main role is to manage the support channel and its representatives.\xa0


Guiding, motivating and building out best practise processes to grow the support channel through excellent relationships and satisfaction with our customers.


The Position


* Meet and exceed SLA’s with our customers

* Build out best practice processes

* Motivate support representatives

* Manage customer expectation

* Escalate issue through right channels to ensure resolution

* Work with Account Management and Professional Services team to ensure that customer has a unified message and experience across all channels.

* Manage customer complaints and work with the business on resolutions

* Evaluate & implement change improving customers outcomes and experience with Annexa

* Train & coach support representatives

* Report to management team

* Coordinate, manage deliver, internal process & system improvement projects

* Approve & analyse employee time sheets

* Analyse and support metrics

* Create procedural documentation in line with best practice

* Monitor and report on KPI’s associated with support SLA’s to management on a regular basis.

* Prepare and present a monthly support analysis report to customers



What you need:


* Previous Customer Service and or support roles serving IT applications

* A bright personality with great communication skills

* Strong problem solving & decision-making skills

* Ability to build strong customer relationships

* University degree or equivalent

* Australian permanent resident

* Proven management experience

* Analytical & reporting skills

* Previous support system experience – Zendesk, ServiceNow, Jira Service Desk or Equivalent



If you have these skills and are interested in being a key member of an exciting team with vast career opportunities, then we would really like to hear from you.

Sales Account Manager

Company Name RFI Technology Solutions Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 153 views

Job description

RFI are one of Australia’s most experienced solar distributors, providing equipment, design and technical support to the solar industry nationally across Australia and into the Pacific. An opportunity has become available for an experienced Sales Account Manager to join our solar sales team in Melbourne\xa0 to cover Victoria, SA and Tasmania.


The Sales Account Manager will maximise solar sales across Victoria, SA and Tasmania regions, both through new account development and management of existing customer accounts. \xa0


The role will also work closely with the broader RFI field sales team and customer support team to deliver great customer service and meet the sales targets of RFI. Based in the Melbourne office and reporting to the State Sales Manager, the role will have a focus on bringing RFI technology solutions to market with solar, storage and the data services that enable them.


You will have experience in selling electrical or solar PV systems and have a minimum of two years' experience in field sales, preferably in distribution.\xa0 A successful track record of successful customer acquisition and your account management sales skills will have earned you customer admiration and loyalty.

\xa0

You will have a structured approach to territory management and experience with getting the best out of CRM platforms. You will work well with others and have a strong drive for delivering to customers' expectations and needs.


Please note that only suitably qualified candidates will be short listed.

CAD Technician

Company Name Stylecraft Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 134 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Stylecraft is a market leader in the supply of original, contemporary furniture. The Stylecraft collection of furniture and lighting is suitable for commercial, government, education, hospitality and residential spaces across Australia and throughout Asia. Based in the Melbourne CBD, this is a unique and exciting opportunity to join our Systems Team.

\xa0

About the role:

\xa0

The role of CAD Technician is a key part of the Systems Team. The primary function of the Systems team is to assist the Sales team in securing technical product specifications and delivering a premium systems solution to our clients. Your role will involve collaboration and consultation with both our suppliers, manufacturers, sales team and our clients. This is an entry level role and would be well suited to someone who has recently completed their Graduate Degree in either Interior or Industrial Design. You will be well supported, working closely with the Systems Team across both the Melbourne and Sydney offices. The position is located at Stylecraft’s newly renovated offices in the heart of Melbourne CBD. \xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Primary role and responsibilities: \xa0

\xa0

  • Assist the sales team with all internal processes; technical consultation and support \xa0

  • CAD specification drawings made according to client requirements/ FF&E schedules \xa0

  • Produce shop drawings for modular configurations and custom/bespoke products

  • Creation of standard shop drawings and technical documentation \xa0

  • Liaise with suppliers on specification drawings for production and manufacture \xa0

  • Build and maintain a 2D/3D library of systems products

  • Produce sketch up and rendering presentations

  • Occasional site visits for measuring and technical consultation with clients

\xa0

Skills and experience: \xa0

\xa0

  • Formal tertiary education – Interior Design / Industrial Design or Architectural Drafting

  • Proficient with AutoCAD / Revit / Sketch Up

  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Products

  • High level of technical expertise and great attention to detail

  • Methodical, structured and efficient work practices \xa0

  • Solutions focused individual with a positive mindset and can-do attitude

Job description

  • Docklands, VIC
  • Permanent Full Time


At Transurban, we rely on our forward thinking technology to enable us to do our work effectively, keeping our customers’ front of mind. As the Senior End User Engineer, you will provide frontline support across a range of Workspace Technology Operations. This includes provisioning, maintenance and management of in-house and outsourced solutions, process improvement and support. If you enjoy thinking differently, working in a collaborative environment and pushing the boundaries on where technology can take us, we would love to hear from you.

Technology at Transurban goes beyond best practice. Our teams work at the bleeding edge of intelligent transport systems. They integrate roadside systems with weather data, develop intuitive payment apps and embrace the latest cloud thinking. The systems and applications we build, operate and maintain make travel easier. Here, you’ll make a difference you can feel.

The impact you’ll have
  • You will assist with the leadership of a growing End User Services team
  • You’ll think bigger and always look for better solutions and ways of working by keeping up to date with industry updates and look to implement best practice ideas in to the business
  • You’ll provide support across a variety of systems, provide training where and when needed to improve end user knowledge


The talents you’ll bring
  • You will have leadership/supervisory experience within a technical team
  • You’ll enjoy problem solving, and enjoy the various challenges that come with a fast-paced and evolving organisation.
  • As a strong communicator, you enjoy dealing with various stakeholders, both technical and non-technical
  • Experience working across both Windows 10 and MacOS environments, as well as Active Directory, SCCM, Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Server 2012
  • Knowledge with mobile device management environments (Preferably AirWatch)
  • Experience in a similar role supporting Cisco, Microsoft and Apple systems that are enterprise level and mission critical


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

[

Associate Nurse Unit Manager (Intensive Care Unit)

Company Name Barwon Health Company Location Geelong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Be recognised - Work in a well-respected, regional tertiary Intensive Care Unit
  • Be challenged - Challenge yourself in a mixed adult and paediatric ICU, with a nurse led ECMO service
  • Be your best - Thrive professionally in providing your clinical expertise and leadership to the Intensive Care Unit
  • Be the heart of Barwon Health - Build your career with a dedicated team at Victoria’s 2014 People in Health Award Winner!


About The Facility

The Intensive Care Unit at University Hospital Geelong is a 24 bed ICU, providing tertiary critical care services to the Barwon South Western region. Our ICU cares for medical, surgical and cardiothoracic adult patients, as well as collaborative programs to care for adult ECMO patients and critically ill children.

ICU runs a deteriorating patient program, supplies a central vascular access service and critical care echocardiography service to Barwon Health. ICU is actively involved in clinical research, safety and quality, critical care education for Deakin School of Medicine, education and training to Critical Care nursing students through LaTrobe University.

About The Role

As the Associate Nurse Unit Manager (ANUM), your primary objective is to provide leadership in the planning and delivery of a high quality service within ICU, whilst developing a professional and collaborative partnership in the overall management of the Intensive Care Unit.

About The Culture

Our dedicated and experienced nursing team pride themselves on providing high quality, evidence-based, patient centred care. We work in a modern and well equipped facility.

Barwon Health Staff Benefits
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Professional development
  • Access to employee wellness facility
  • Salary packaging
  • Social club
  • Be our future Barwon Health Strategic Plan
  • Aboriginal Employment Plan
  • Our Commitment to Child Safety

At Barwon Health we celebrate and harness diversity, and consider it a competitive advantage. We encourage applications from all diverse backgrounds including individuals that identify as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, GLBTIQ+, and individuals with disability. Our organisation promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of all our consumers including children and appropriate rigorous reference and background checks will be undertaken. Barwon Health is proud to be Totally Smoke Free
